form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Banks introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To prohibit Federal funding for National Public Radio, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Defund NPR Act.

section.header: Prohibition on Federal funding for National Public Radio

subsection.text: Section 396 of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 396) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Prohibition on Federal funding for National Public Radio

paragraph.text: After the date of enactment of the Defund NPR Act, no Federal funds may, directly or indirectly, be made available to or used to support an organization described in paragraph (2), including through the payment of dues to or the purchase of programming from the organization by a public broadcast station using Federal funds received by the station.
The organizations described in this paragraph are—

subparagraph.text: the organization known, as of the date of enactment of the Defund NPR Act, as National Public Radio; and
any successor organization to the organization described in subparagraph (A).

subsection.text: Title III of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 301 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (4), in the first sentence, by striking or National Public Radio; and
in paragraph (9), by striking or National Public Radio each place that term appears; and

paragraph.text: in section 398(b)(1) (47 U.S.C. 398(b)(1)), by striking and National Public Radio.
